dca.com
Class DayCounter

java.lang.Object
  dca.com.DayCounter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DayCounterData
 class DayCounter
extends java.lang.Object

DayCounter Class subclass DayCounterData The purpose of this class is to provide the calculation backbone of any GUI interface required to display the difference of dates.

Since:
2011.0711
Version:
1.6
Author:
Sherman Ying

private  java.lang.String buffer
          This is the result buffer that is passed to the display.

          This is the count variable used to save the calculation.

          This array stores whether either date is a leap year.
private  java.lang.String[] monthNames
          This array holds the names of the months for both dates.
private  int order
          This saves the relationship between both dates.

Method Summary
private  void compareDates()
          This method will determine the direct relationship between the dates, whether it be the first date being after or before, or even being identical to the second.

order

private int order
This saves the relationship between both dates. 0 = same, 1 = Date A > Date B, 2 = Date B > Date A.

leap

This array stores whether either date is a leap year.

processInfo

void processInfo()
This is a calling method that begins the process of calculation, as well as any other calculations required.

getMonthNum

int getMonthNum(java.lang.String name)
This method is used to find a matching name of the month in the enum MONTHS to get the month number.

Parameters:
name - - the name of the month to return.
Returns:
int month - the corresponding month number.

Accessor method. Returns the result string to the GUI for display.

Returns:

Accessor method. Returns the counting calculation, for whatever purpose not covered in this class.

Returns:
double count - the variable that stores the number of days last calculated.

countDays

int countDays(int x,
              int y)
This method very simply calculates the days within a month, allowing for quick addition/subtraction when calculating the difference of days.

Parameters:
x - - month.
y - - year.
Returns:
z - the number of days in that particular month.

compareDates

private void compareDates()
This method will determine the direct relationship between the dates, whether it be the first date being after or before, or even being identical to the second.

MonthName

private void MonthName()
Reverse of getMonth(), using the month number to match to the name. Uses the enum MONTHS to match.

counter

private void counter()
This method actually calculates the number of days between any two given dates, using a simple algorithm to add/subtract dates until the dates "match".

validate

java.lang.Boolean validate(int g)
This method will check to see whether any of the dates are non-existent or invalid, circumventing any possible calculation errors.

Parameters:
g - - Selector variable
Returns:
Boolean - true if the date is a real date, false if not.
